result.execSummary:
The defendant Latasha L Ratelis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations including costs of supervision during the term of probation.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care along with cognitive intervention therapy. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment or attend school full time or a combination of both equal to full time.Defendant must continue to go to every class unless she has a doctor's excuse, perform every assignment to the best of her ability. Do not disrupt class at all and be at every class.   Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law, within 60 days, and pay for the testing.  Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on probation.

Defendant does not plan to seek postconviction relief.

Defendant Latasha L Ratelis in court with attorney Christopher James Simonds.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Maggie Techert.
The State indicates there are no Ch. 950 implications. Parties have reviewed the PSI. No additions or corrections noted by parties. The State recommends is 3 yrs bifurcated as 18/18-I/S and probation and conditions left up to the discretion of the Court.

BTC: Total sentence is 3 yrs WPS bifurcated as 18 mos IC, 18 mos ES/CFTS - STAYED.  3 yrs probation.
               Defendant may motion for expungement if she successfully completes all terms of probation

costs

any counseling deemed approp by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment, and after care along with cognitive intervention therapy
FT emp/school = FT
Defendant must continue to go to every class unless she has a doctor's excuse, perform every assignment to the best of her ability, do not discrupt class at all, be at every class
FAW/vote

ZCI

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:    It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Must continue employment at Warren Packaging.  If no longer employed, must contact attorney and the Court.
for bond review
